kenny.bio: Kenny Haiti, born Kenny Sinvil in Saint-Marc, is a rising star in the Haitian music scene. After moving to Florida in 2007, he transformed from aspiring basketball player to celebrated musician, earning the Best Caribbean Artist Trace Award. His 2018 breakout hit "Jou Pa Nou" garnered over 1 million views, establishing him as a fresh voice in konpa and Afro-Caribbean music. With 1 million Instagram followers and a growing international fanbase, Kenny Haiti continues to bridge traditional Haitian rhythms with contemporary sounds, representing the vibrant culture of the Haitian diaspora. Beyond music, he's an entrepreneur with his Krezi Mayo merchandise line, staying connected to his roots while building his American dream.
career_highlights: Best Caribbean Artist Trace Award Winner
1M+ followers on Instagram
Debut music video "Jou Pa Nou" exceeded 1 million views
Successful Krezi Mayo merchandise line
10+ years building fanbase in Haitian diaspora

reviews.review_text: Kenny made my daughter's birthday so special! He spoke in perfect Creole and even mentioned her favorite song. The energy was amazing!
Incredible message for my graduation! Kenny's words were so motivating and he really understood what this achievement meant to our family.
Great message, delivered quickly. Kenny has such a positive vibe and great voice. Would definitely book again!

tvice.bio: T-Vice stands as one of Haiti's most influential konpa bands, formed in 1992 by brothers Roberto and Reynaldo Martino as successors to the legendary Top Vice. Based in Miami, this revolutionary quartet transformed konpa music by infusing it with reggae, merengue, and rock influences, creating an energetic party atmosphere that captivated audiences worldwide. With over three decades of international touring across the US, Caribbean, and Europe, T-Vice has collaborated with superstars like Wyclef Jean and Buju Banton while maintaining their authentic Haitian roots. The band's innovative approach and enduring popularity has secured their position among the top 3 konpa acts globally, bridging generations and cultures through their infectious rhythms and passionate performances.
career_highlights: 32+ year career as one of Haiti's most influential konpa bands
Ranked in Top 3 konpa acts alongside Alan Cavé and Djakout Mizik
Collaborated with Wyclef Jean and Buju Banton on 'Party By The Sea'
International touring across US, Caribbean, and Europe
Revolutionized konpa with energetic party atmosphere and modern influences

reviews.review_text: T-Vice made our wedding anniversary unforgettable! The whole band participated and they played a snippet of our favorite song. Absolutely magical!
Amazing energy from the legendary T-Vice! They congratulated my son on his graduation with such warmth and even gave career advice. Worth every penny!
Beautiful message for my mother's 70th birthday. T-Vice's harmonies are incredible and they made it so personal. She cried tears of joy!

carimi.bio: Carimi emerged in 2001 as "konpa music revivalists," transforming Haitian music with their socially conscious digital sound. Formed in New York City by three educated musicians—Carlo Vieux, Richard Cavé, and Mickael Guirand—the band addressed Haiti's political struggles while captivating the diaspora worldwide. Their debut "Haiti Bang, Bang" became an instant classic, launching a career that sold over one million albums and earned international awards. Pioneers in digital innovation, Carimi became the first Haitian band to create a mobile app and made history in 2024 with the first konpa arena concert in the United States. Though they disbanded in 2016, their reunion tours demonstrate their enduring legacy as cultural ambassadors bridging Haiti's heritage with global audiences.
career_highlights: Konpa music revivalists with over 1 million albums sold worldwide
Best Compas/Racine entertainer (2008 International Reggae and World Music Awards)
Song of the Year (2010 Konpa Magazine Award)
First Haitian band to create a konpa mobile app
Historic first arena concert in US (UBS Arena, 2024)

reviews.review_text: Carimi delivered the most beautiful anniversary message! All three members participated and they harmonized our names into a song. Absolutely stunning!
Incredible graduation message from the legendary Carimi! They shared wisdom about education and success that really resonated. My whole family was moved.
Perfect birthday surprise for my husband! Carimi's message was so heartfelt and they included references to their classic songs. He was speechless!

djakout.bio: Djakout Mizik stands as one of Haiti's most enduring musical institutions, pioneering the "nouvelle génération" electronic konpa sound since 1986. Led by vocalist Auguste "Pouchon" Duverger, this legendary ensemble bridges traditional compas with modern electronic elements, earning recognition as "the band that moves crowds the most." From their groundbreaking MTV appearance with Wyclef Jean to surviving a 2010 band split that spawned the hit "Eskive," Djakout Mizik has weathered every storm while maintaining their position among the top 3 konpa acts globally. With nearly four decades of cultural influence, they continue to represent authentic Haitian music while embracing innovation, making them beloved ambassadors of konpa music to generations of fans worldwide.
career_highlights: Pioneers of 'nouvelle génération' electronic konpa music (38-year career)
Consistently ranked in Top 3 konpa acts alongside T-Vice and Alan Cavé
First Haitian konpa group to perform on MTV (New Year's Eve 2007 with Wyclef Jean)
Extensive discography with 34+ releases
Survived major challenges including shooting incident and band split

reviews.review_text: Djakout Mizik gave the most powerful blessing for my son's wedding! Pouchon's voice is legendary and the whole band's energy came through. Unforgettable!
Amazing graduation message! Djakout's words about perseverance really hit home. They're living proof that Haitian music can conquer the world!
Beautiful birthday message with that classic Djakout sound! They made my mother feel like a queen. The nouvelle génération style never gets old!

harmonik.bio: Harmonik has been a driving force in contemporary Haitian konpa music since 2005, led by vocalist Nickenson Prud'homme. Over two decades, they've established themselves as "one of the leading groups on the Haitian Konpa scene," blending catchy melodies, danceable rhythms, and poetic lyrics that resonate with audiences worldwide. From their breakthrough album "Jere m'" to their latest "Idantite'n," Harmonik has consistently evolved konpa music while honoring its roots. Their groundbreaking 2025 collaboration "Magical Ride" with Nigerian artist Rotimi exemplifies their innovative spirit, creating Afro-konpa fusion that celebrates cultural diversity. Known for energetic performances and commitment to promoting Haitian culture, Harmonik continues to bridge generations through their modern take on traditional konpa.
career_highlights: 'One of the leading groups on the Haitian Konpa scene' since 2005
20-year career with consistent album releases and evolution
International touring and global fanbase
Pioneer in Afro-konpa collaboration with Nigerian artist Rotimi
Eight studio albums spanning nearly two decades

reviews.review_text: Harmonik's cultural pride message for Haiti Day was absolutely beautiful! Nickenson's voice gave me chills and the message about identity was perfect.
Great graduation message from Harmonik! They really understood what this milestone meant and their encouragement was heartfelt. Modern konpa at its best!
Perfect birthday surprise! Harmonik made it so personal and their harmonies are incredible. The blend of traditional and modern was exactly what we wanted.

belo.bio: BélO (Jean Bélony Murat) stands as Haiti's premier musical ambassador, weaving social consciousness into "Ragganga" style music that blends reggae, jazz, and Caribbean influences. Born in 1979 near Port-au-Prince, this socially conscious artist has released six acclaimed albums since 2005's breakthrough "Lakou trankil," addressing issues from violence to homelessness while proposing solutions through his art. As World Vision's Goodwill Ambassador and winner of multiple international awards including the Discovery RFI Prime, BélO has gained recognition across Europe and Africa while maintaining deep roots in Haitian culture. His rich Creole vocals and guitar mastery have earned him recent honors from Miami-Dade County to Nassau County, cementing his role as both entertainer and advocate for peace and resilience in the Haitian community worldwide.
career_highlights: 30-year career as Haiti's musical ambassador to the world
World Vision Goodwill Ambassador in Haiti (2018)
Discovery RFI Prime winner (2006)
Multiple 2023 awards: Miami-Dade County, Nassau County, TCCF Citizenship Award
Popular across Europe and Africa with social impact focus

reviews.review_text: BélO's motivational message changed my perspective on life! His words about resilience and his guitar playing were so moving. A true ambassador for Haiti!
Incredible heritage celebration message! BélO's passion for Haitian culture shines through every word. Perfect for our family reunion in the diaspora.
Powerful message about social responsibility! BélO's commitment to positive change is inspiring. His approach to addressing difficult topics is both gentle and impactful.
